channel.title: Showing the attack option only in wild?
channel.description: How would I do this? I've tried before, but it would always crash everyone online and say 'stack empty' on the runserver bat

item.title: Showing the attack option only in wild?
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

Search for:

		outStream.writeString("Trade with");

You’ll see this:

outStream.writeString("Trade with"); outStream.endFrameVarSize(); outStream.createFrameVarSize(104); outStream.writeByteC(2); outStream.writeByteA(0); outStream.writeString("Duel"); outStream.endFrameVarSize(); outStream.createFrameVarSize(104); outStream.writeByteC(3); outStream.writeByteA(0); outStream.writeString("Attack"); outStream.endFrameVarSize();

Delete this part:

outStream.writeString("Attack"); outStream.endFrameVarSize();

If that doesnt work, try deleting the 3 lines above it, 1 by one, Been a few weeks since I deleted it, so I forgot

Read full topic
item.source: Showing the attack option only in wild?

item.title: Showing the attack option only in wild?
item.dc:creator: @xx_nub_xx xx nub xx
item.description:
@xx_nub_xx wrote:

			if((nonWild()) {
			outStream.createFrameVarSize(104);
			outStream.writeByteC(3);		// command slot (does it matter which one?)
			outStream.writeByteA(0);		// 0 or 1; 1 if command should be placed on top in context menu
			outStream.writeString("@whi@E@gre@x@whi@a@gre@m@whi@i@gre@n@whi@e");
			outStream.endFrameVarSize();
			} else if(!nonWild()) {
			outStream.createFrameVarSize(104);
			outStream.writeByteC(3);		// command slot (does it matter which one?)
			outStream.writeByteA(1);		// 0 or 1; 1 if command should be placed on top in context menu
			outStream.writeString("@whi@K@gre@i@whi@l@gre@l");
			outStream.endFrameVarSize();
			}

put that into process()

Read full topic
